results.title: Voronet
results.brief_description: A detailed presentation of the painted and carved stone frescoes at Voronet monastery in Romania. Showing Byzantine influence, the church was decorated when Moldavian culture was at its height in 1488 during the reign of Stephen the Great. The work is full of life and local colour; its diversity of style reflects the imprint of each artists’ personality. Includes paintings in the knave, vault, porch and exterior walls, one of which is like an Eastern carpet with human figures depicted against an azure background amid floral motifs.

results.title: Voltati eugenio = They all loved him
results.creator_credit: Les Films du Losange, Moonfleet, Intercontinental and Luigi Comencini
results.brief_description:
Soon after the birth of their child Eugenio, a married couple decide parenthood interferes too much with their freedom and leave him to be raised by his grandparents. When Eugenio is ten years old his father sends a friend to collect him but believing the boy will only cause trouble, and irritated by his behaviour, the friend abandons the boy on a deserted road. The father is horrified and sets out to find him. Eventually after many adventures on his own, he is found and taken home, but the affection showered on him by his family is short-lived and he runs away, his departure going unnoticed by those around him. Luigi Comencini made his first feature film in 1948 and was an advocate of the Neorealist movement. However he tempered his realist approach with solid commercialism. His best (and most profitable) films include the Gina Lollobrigida showcase ‘Bread, Love and Dreams’ (1953) and its sequels. In 1987, Comencini was the recipient of a Career Achievement award from the Venice Festival.

Credits: Director, writer, Luigi Comencini.
Cast: Saverio Marconi, Dalila di Lazzaro, Meme Prlini, Francesco Bonelli, Carole Andre, Bernard Blier

results.title: Volpone
results.brief_description:
After one of his ships fails to return safely to Venice, Volpone, a wealthy merchant finds himself crippled with debts and sent to prison. When the ship finally appears, Volpone is released, vying for revenge. With the help of Mosca, a former cellmate, Volpone fakes his own death and bequests his fortune to Mosca. At first, Volpone enjoys the spectacle of his greedy creditors fighting for the spoils. But then the joke turns sour as Mosca proceeds to evict Volpone from his own palace.

Credits: Producer, A. Hertz ; director, Maurice Tourneur ; writer, Jules Romains ; photography, Armand Thirard ; music, Marcel Delannoy.
Cast: Harry Baur, Louis Jouvet, Charles Dullin, Jacqueline Delubac, Alexandre Rignault, Fernand Ledoux, Pierre Sabbagh.

results.title: Volleyball: a sport come of age
results.brief_description:
Provides a brief history of the development of the game of volleyball and moves on to show the current American volleyball scene with the main emphasis on beach volleyball.
Suitable for upper primary and lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Volleyball for boys
results.brief_description: Rules of the game and modifications made to adopt it to local conditions are shown. Detailed instruction is given on serving, volleying, spiking and defensive play. Class drills for the perfection of skills as well as actual game play are also shown.

results.title: Volleyball for beginners. Part one. The game
results.creator_credit: Alan Simpson, Brian M. Williams and Sports Films
results.brief_description: Comments on the rise in popularity of volleyball since it became an Olympic sport. The National Volleyball Team demonstrates the basic techniques: positions on court, volleying, heading practice, service, receiving and spiking. The importance of teamwork and drills for improving reactions are shown and a short game is played.

results.title: Volcanoes: exploring the restless earth
results.creator_credit: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: On-location photography and animated drawings illustrate volcanic phenomena in Hawaii, Mexico, Italy and Iceland. The film distinguishes shield, cinder cone and strato-volcano by showing how each type of volcano is formed and how each erupts. Before and after footage of the 1973 destruction of Helgarfjell on Iceland’s Heimaey Island vividly documents the effect of volcanic eruptions on man and his environment. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Volcanoes, earthquakes, and other earth movements
results.creator_credit: Reinald Werrenrath Jr and Goldberg-Werrenrath Productions
results.brief_description: Indicates that volcanoes and earthquakes are evidence of a natural process called plate tectonics. Shows how to chart part movements of these crustal plates and how to make predictions about their movements. The program also uses excellent location film such as the eruption of the Mt St Helens volcano in Norther America. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Volcanoes
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Earth”.
Evidence of high termperature and pressure beneath the earth’s surface is seen in bubbling mud pots, hot spering geysers, lava fountains and thunderous volcanic eruptions. Further effects of volcanic action on the earth’s crust are seen in cinder cones, crater lakes, calderas, shield and strato-volcanoes.
